Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Hurry! We hear a loud BANG followed by muffled CURSING from below. Jane offers a hand down to ERIK SELVIG  who emerges as well, rubbing his head.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Thanks. So what's this "anomaly" of yours supposed to look like?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: It's a little different each time. Once it looked like, I don't know, melted stars, pooling in a corner of the sky. But last week it was a rolling rainbow ribbon--

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Hey, Darcy. Pass up the bubbly and my gloves, will you? Intern DARCY LEWIS  hands Jane a bottle of Champagne and a pair of gloves through the window. Jane passes it to Selvig to hold while she pulls on the old gloves -- too large and masculine for her small hands. He starts to unwrap the foil, and she stops his hand with an excited grin.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I recognize those. Think how proud he'd be to see you now. Jane's grin fades to a sad smile.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: The benefit of the doubt. The two stare out at the sky expectantly. A long beat while they scan the skies. Nothing. Jane's worried.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Sure, if you like rocking out to KFRM, "All agriculture, all the time." Worried, Jane heads back down into the vehicle.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: The anomalies are always precipitated by geomagnetic storms. She shows him a complicated CHART she's drawn in the book, tracking occurrences and patterns.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Jane? Jane SHUSHES her, leafs through her notes. The bottle of champagne begins to vibrate.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: There's got to be some new variable... Or an equipment malfunction... The lights and equipment in the SUV begin to FLICKER around them. The computer monitors SQUELCH with static.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I don't think there's anything wrong with your equipment... The champagne bottle starts to RATTLE noisily now as it shakes more violently. Jane and Selvig notice.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I think you want to see this. Darcy points out the window. Jane and Selvig look out. Over the desert --

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Holy. Shatner.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: That's your "subtle" aurora?!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: No-- yes! Let's go!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Isn't this great?! A thought strikes her.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: That's debateable. Put your seat belt on!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You've gotta get us closer so I can take a magnetic reading. Darcy laughs.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Yeah, right! Good one!  Oh God, you're serious...

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You want those college credits or not?

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Keep the credits. I'll intern at Burger King.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What are you doing?!

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Saving our lives! Jane grabs the wheel, jerks it hard the other way. They struggle for control, when the headlights fall on --

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I think that was legally your fault.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Get the first aid kit. Darcy heads back inside the SUV as Jane, concerned, kneels next to the man. Selvig hovers, protectively. She gently turns his head to the light, and we see him clearly for the first time. He is magnificently handsome, long blonde hair flowing around his classically sculpted features. She cups her hands around his face, as if willing the life back into him.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Wow. Does he need CPR? Because I know CPR. A flustered Jane smooths her hair and sits back on her heels. She looks up at Selvig. Back to being a scientist.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: --are dilating. That's a good sign.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: We still have to get him to a hospital.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Immediately, Jane. Jane sighs and nods, regretfully watching the storm EVAPORATE above their heads. A thought strikes her.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Where did he come from? They exchange puzzled looks, as we move up through the last glowing remnants of the storm, and into:

Speaker: odin allfather
Dialogue: Stares out at his kingdom. The ravens fly up to the balcony, land at his side.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Do you think he's ready?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: He thinks he is. He has his father's confidence.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: He'll need his father's wisdom.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: And his humility? Odin reacts.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Yes, but Thor's still a boy. He could be a great King... Odin stops, notices HIS HAND SHAKING. It seems to be out of synch temporally with the rest of the world, leaving a trail as it moves. He stares at it determinedly, concentrating, trying to stop the strange event through the force of his sheer will.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: For once, our son needs something we cannot provide.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: I can fight it a little longer...

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: No. You've put it off too long! I worry for you. He touches her cheek.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: I've destroyed demons and monsters, devastated whole worlds, laid waste to mighty kingdoms, and still you worry for me?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Always.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Not today. Now come kiss your king... while I'm still king. He pulls her close, and they kiss.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Another!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Have you ever known me to be nervous?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: There was the time in Nornheim...

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: That wasn't nerves, brother. It was the rage of battle. How else could I have fought my way through a hundred warriors and pulled us out alive? The Attendant approaches with another goblet of wine for Thor.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: As I recall, I was the one who veiled us in smoke to ease our escape.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Some do battle, others just do tricks. The Attendant stifles a laugh. Loki notices, doesn't like it. He gestures towards the goblet in the Attendant's hand. EELS pour over the sides of the goblet, slithering out and across the terrified Attendant's hand. He SCREAMS, hurls the goblet to the ground. Loki chuckles.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Just a bit of fun.  Right, my friend? The Attendant isn't so sure. Thor dons his EAGLE-WINGED

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You don't really want to start this again, do you, Cow?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I was being sincere!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're incapable of sincerity.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Am I? He looks his brother in the eye, all pretense lost.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Thank you. The two brothers take in the moment a beat, then:

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Give us a kiss.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Stop. Thor makes the final adjustments to his ceremonial wear.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Like a king. They hear the blast of a CEREMONIAL HORN.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You go ahead. Loki casts him a wary look.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Thank you, love.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: I'll miss you.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: I hope this goes quickly. I'm famished.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Are you attached to that pretty face of yours? Because one more word, and you won't be.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: My, we are hungry, aren't we? The others laugh, save Hogun. Fandral turns to him.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Fandral, is it true the famous Warriors Three are ready to meet any challenge?

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Name it, Lady Sif.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Keep your mouth shut.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: It's all right to be nervous.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Why does everyone keep saying that? I'm not nervous!

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: You may be able to fool the rest of

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: ...but never you. I know.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Thor, just remember that you have something even the great Allfather never had.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: And what is that?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Me for a mother. She smiles.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: He said he'd be along. Sif realizes the truth, shakes her head in disapproval.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: He wants to make an entrance.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Well, if he doesn't show up soon, he shouldn't bother. Odin looks like he's ready to feed him to his ravens.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I wouldn't worry. Father will forgive him. He always does.

Speaker: mjolnir
Dialogue: Roars up into the hall, Thor strides cockily into the hall behind it, catching it behind his back. The CROWD erupts in CHEERS. Thor spins his hammer with a flourish, holds it up before the crowd, basking in the moment, relishing the adoration, whipping his audience up into a frenzy.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Oh, please. Odin watches from the front, not liking this showy display.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Gungnir. Its aim is true, its power strong. With it I have defended Asgard and the lives of the innocent across the Nine Realms since the time of the Great Beginning. And though the day has come for a new King to wield his own weapon -- that duty remains the same. Thor Odinson, my heir, my first-born.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Today I entrust you with the greatest honor in all the Nine Realms. The sacred throne of Asgard. I have sacrificed much to achieve peace. So, too, must a new generation sacrifice to maintain that peace. Responsibility, duty, honor. These are not merely virtues to which we must aspire. They are essential to every soldier and to every King. The Crowd and the Warriors Three start to shiver and rub their limbs for warmth in the increasingly cold air of the hall. Thor turns back to face his father. Odin looks upon his son with pride.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I swear.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Do you swear to preserve the peace?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I swear.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Do you swear to cast aside all selfish ambition and pledge yourself only to the good of all the Realms? Beat.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I swear.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Then on this day, I, Odin Allfather, proclaim you-- Odin hesitates, noticing a strange sight before him. ICE creeps across the surface of the large banners around the hall, making an eerie CRACKING sound. Thor, his comrades, and the crowd see it too.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: The Destroyer.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: I've never been inside the Vault before. It's said the Tesseract was once held here.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Shush! Odin surveys the destruction.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: The Jotuns must pay for what they've done!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: They have paid with their lives. The Destroyer did its job, and the Casket is safe. All is well.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: "All is well?!" They broke into the Weapons Vault! If the Frost Giants had stolen even one of these

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: But they didn't.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I want to know why they--

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: And if you hadn't taken it from them they would have laid waste to all the Nine Realms!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: I have a truce with Laufey, the Jotun King.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: He just broke your truce! We must act! Odin turns to Sif and the Warriors Three.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Leave us. Thor's comrades exit. Odin eyes Thor, as Loki watches.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: March into Jotunheim as you once did, teach them a lesson, break their spirits so they'll never dare try to cross our borders again!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You're thinking only as a warrior!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: This was an act of war!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: It was the act of but a few, doomed to fail.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: They got this far!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: We will find the breach in our defenses. It will be found, and it will be sealed.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: As King of Asgard, I would--

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You are not King. Not yet. Thor sees in his father's face that he's pushed this as far as he can. He backs away, then leaves, pushing through the doors so hard that they SLAM backwards behind him. Odin watches him go.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Redecorating, are we? Volstagg surveys the overturned tables and food, aghast.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: What's this -- ?!

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: I told you they'd cancel it.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: We thought that was just you being your normal cheery self. Volstagg looks about the floor, despairing.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: All this food -- so innocent, cast to the ground. It breaks the heart! Thor strides away from them to the far end of the hall. Loki calmly moves towards him.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It's unwise to be in my company right now, brother.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Who said I was wise?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: This was to be my day of triumph.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: It will come. In time.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Yes, exactly!

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: But there's nothing we can do without defying Father. Thor considers this, looks at his hammer, a gleam in his eye. Loki can guess what he's thinking, grows concerned.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It's the only way to ensure the safety of our borders.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: It's madness!

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Madness? What sort of madness?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Nothing! Thor was making a jest!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: The safety of our Realm is no jest. We're going to Jotunheim.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Thor, of all the laws of Asgard, this is one you must not break. Loki looks on, intrigued by the proceedings.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: This isn't like a journey to Earth, where you summon a little lightning and thunder and the mortals worship you as a god. This is Jotunheim.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: And if the Frost Giants don't kill you, your Father will!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: My father fought his way into Jotunheim, defeated their armies, and took their Casket! We'd just be looking for answers.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: It is forbidden! Thor sizes up his friends, smiles. He proceeds to make his case with enthusiasm and charismatic conviction.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: My friends, have you forgotten all that we've done together? He turns to Fandral.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: You did.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: And who proved wrong all who scoffed at the idea that a young maiden could be one of the fiercest warriors this Realm has ever known?

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: I did.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You are coming with me...

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Yes, of course! I won't let my brother march into Jotunheim alone. I will be at his side.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: And I.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: And I.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: And I. The Warriors Three fight together.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: I fear we'll live to regret this.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: If we're lucky.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: We must first find a way to get past Heimdall.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: That will be no easy task. It's said the Gatekeeper can see a single dew drop fall from a blade of grass a thousand worlds away.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: And he can hear a cricket passing gas in Niffelheim.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Jest not! He heareth all!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Please. Getting past him should be simple enough now, since he seems to be letting Frost Giants sneak by under his nose. Volstagg, terrified, calls out to the sky.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Forgive him! He meaneth no offense! Loki rejoins the group as Thor leads them onward.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Keep your weapons sheathed and your mouths closed. This is going to take subtlety and sincerity, not brute strength. Leave it to me. Loki dismounts and steps forward.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: You're not dressed warmly enough. Thor, Loki, and the others trade looks.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I'm sorry?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: The freezing cold of Jotunheim. It will kill you all in time, even Thor.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: That was just a bit of a jest, really... Loki goes into damage control.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You must be mistaken. We're not--

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: For ages have I guarded Asgard and kept it safe from those who would do it harm. In all that time, never has an enemy slipped by my watch -- until this day. I wish to know how that happened.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Then tell no one where we've gone until we've returned. Thor walks past Heimdall as the Gatekeeper lets the group pass. Volstagg walks beside the frustrated Loki, needles him.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: What happened? Your silver tongue turn to lead?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Get me off this bridge before it cracks under your girth. Volstagg and Fandral share a laugh.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Be warned. I will honor my sworn oath to protect this Realm as its Gatekeeper. If your return threatens the safety of Asgard, Bifrost will remain closed to you. You'll be left to die in the cold wastes of Jotunheim.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I have no plans to die today.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: None do. Heimdall inserts his sword into the control panel, and the apparatus of the Observatory starts up.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: All is ready. You may pass.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Couldn't you just leave the bridge open for us?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: To keep this bridge open would unleash the full power of the Bifrost and destroy Jotunheim with you upon it.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Ah. Never mind, then. Thor starts towards the Bifrost, turns back to the others, grins.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Come on. Don't be bashful. The others join him at his side, then step towards the Bifrost. Their bodies stretch towards the maelstrom, changing shape, as if every atom of their being is being elongated by the pull of it. In an instant, they're jerked off the platform and inside the vortex.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Come on, big fella. Up...! With an effort, Thor pulls the burly warrior back onto the ice and, tremendously relieved, he proclaims:

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: This belt! This belt is now my lucky belt! I will never remove it! Even when bathing!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: You bathe? Thor and the others turn and stare out in horror and wonder at the frozen alien wasteland before them. The whole planet is a massive flattened ring of jagged ice, slowly breaking apart. Huge CHUNKS OF ICE calve away from its outer edges and float off into space. The planet's icy surface cracks and melts as far as the eye can see. The ruins of a Jotun city lies in the distance.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: We shouldn't be here.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Too late now.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Actually, it's not. We could turn right around, hop back to Asgard, share a mug by the fire. Could be nice. Thor ignore him, heads off. Loki looks around, anxious.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Perhaps we should wait. Thor turns back to his brother.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: To survey the enemy. To gauge their strengths and weaknesses from a distance.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: I'm liking that. Gauging, surveying. Particularly the distance part.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: We know all we must. It's time to act. Thor heads on. Reluctantly, the others follow.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: He's just got to swing his hammer...

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It feels good, doesn't it? To be together again, adventuring on another world?

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Adventuring? Is that what we're doing?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What would you call it?

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Freezing.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Starving.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Whining.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: How about a song to lift our spirits? The others groan.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: No, not that!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Please don't make us sing again!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: If I have to listen to Volstagg's singing voice one more time, I'll fall on my own sword!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Well, now I'm on board. She and Thor share a grin. The party reaches the edge of the city -- its ancient structures of jade and ice melting and crumbling, ravaged by warfare long ago. A TEMPLE lies before them, across a central plaza.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Hiding. As cowards always do. Thor leads the others onwards towards the central plaza. Loki reluctantly follows. They don't notice as SHADOWY FIGURES move in the shadows of the structures nearby.

Speaker: jotun sentry
Dialogue: What is your business here, Asgardian? The Jotun's voice itself sounds like cracking ice.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I speak only to your King. Not to his foot soldiers.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: I am Laufey, King of this Realm.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: And I am--

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: We know who you are, Odinson. Why have you brought the stench of your blood into my world?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I demand answers. Laufey stands, sizing up Thor, tries to piece this together.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: You "demand?"

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: How did your people get into Asgard?

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: The house of Odin is full of traitors. Sif and the Warriors Three exchange a puzzled look, disturbed by the Jotun King's words.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Do not dishonor my father's name with your lies.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Your father is a murderer and a thief. He stole what was ours, and left our world in ruins. We have the right to reclaim the Casket.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Not when you'd use it to make war against other Realms. Laufey laughs, cold, mocking.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: And why have you come here? To make peace? You long for battle. You crave it. I see you for what you are, Thor Odinson. Nothing but a boy, trying to prove himself a man.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: This boy has grown tired of your mockery. Thor takes a step towards Laufey. The other Jotuns step in front of Thor, blocking his path. We finally see the Frost Giants now -- terrifying, blue-skinned, standing eight feet tall. Loki moves next to his brother and quietly implores him.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Thor, stop and think. Look around you. We are outnumbered.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Know your place, brother...

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: You should listen to his counsel. You know not what your actions would unleash. Laufey steps out of the shadows.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: We will accept your most gracious offer. The others look to Thor imploringly. Thor stares Laufey down a beat -- then relents. He turns to leave. His comrades breathe a sigh of relief and follow, when a Frost Giant nearby mutters under his breath.

Speaker: jotun
Dialogue: Run back home, little princess. Thor stops in his tracks. Loki goes white. He knows what's coming.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Damn. In one quick move, Thor pulls Mjolnir, swings it, and KNOCKS the Jotun clear across the plaza. The Asgardians reluctantly draw their weapons, gather into a circle around Thor. Volstagg looks around at the angry Jotuns approaching them.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Silly hammer! Has a mind of its own! ICE forms on the Jotuns' bodies, creating a FROZEN ARMOR around them, extending off the ends of their arms like SWORDS. One Giant does so directly in front of Fandral.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: I'm hoping that's just decorative. Thor leaves the circle of Asgardians, swings at another Frost Giant. His comrades form another circle around him, separating him from the Jotuns, as he whirls his hammer around once and catches it with a cocky grin. He's enjoying this.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Next! Fandral calls to Volstagg and Hogun.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Well? What move, do you think?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: I say we use "The Norn's Revenge."

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: At this close range? I think "The Alfheim Lunge" is a better move.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: Shut up! Thor takes out yet another Frost Giant, then all hell breaks loose as the Asgardians and Jotuns begin to battle. A Jotun backs Hogun up against a wall of ice. As the Giant hurls an ice blade fist at him, the grim warrior swings his mace over his head, embedding it into the ice wall, and hoists himself up, dodging the Giant's blow and leaping over him. Hogun takes out a second approaching Frost Giant, spins back, dodges a swing from the first, then pounds the Jotun with his mace. Nearby, Sif expertly stabs one Jotun after another with her double-bladed staff. One knocks her viciously to the ground.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: If you don't treat me like a lady, I won't act like a lady! She takes out the Jotun. Loki backs away from an approaching Jotun, finds himself at the edge of a deep crevasse. The Giant sees he's vulnerable, swipes at him. But the Jotun's arm passes right through him. The Giant stands there, confused, when THE REAL LOKI comes out from behind a structure and shoves the Giant into the crevasse below. The false Loki dissipates into nothingness.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Pathetic. He turns back to the battle. Two Jotuns come at him from either side. He lets two daggers fly, felling both Giants at once. Laufey nods to one of his guards -- a massive Jotun BRUTE. The Brute leaps down from the balcony, icing himself up, then punches his giant fist into the ice beneath his feet. It's a long-range attack, causing PILLARS OF ICE to explode out in front of Hogun, sending the grim warrior flying back. Across the plaza, Thor easily dispatches some Jotuns.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Come on! At least make it a challenge for me! He sees the Brute coming at him. The huge Jotun lands a tremendous blow, sending Thor back across the ice. Thor rises, grins.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: I'm so glad I taught him how to do that! Volstagg grapples with a Frost Giant, getting a couple good hits in.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: You may want to put some ice on that! The Frost Giant fights back, but Volstagg manages to grip in a headlock just as another comes up on him from behind. Volstagg fends him off, then turns the first one loose.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Of course you did. Nearby, a Frost Giant forms a BARRAGE OF ICE BULLETS, hurling them at Sif. Sif raises her shield barely in time, as the bullets go pinging and ricocheting off it. She races into the group of Frost Giants who attacked her and takes them out.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Hang on! Volstagg swings his weapon, wildly hacking at the ice around Hogun's legs to free him. Hogun looks down, suddenly worried, as Volstagg's blade cuts deep -- and perilously close to hacking into Hogun's legs.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: Watch the legs!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: You really think your icicles are a match for Asgardian steel? Fandral lunges at the Giant. The Jotun knocks his blade away.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: That's unfortunate. He hurries to his wounded comrade.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: I may need a bit of help. Not a good look, is it?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Just try not to bleed.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: How's the face?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Flawless. Volstagg begins to pull the bleeding Fandral off the ice stalagmite. Loki plunges two daggers into the chest of one of the Frost Giants. The Giant grabs hold of Loki's gloved wrists. Loki pulls his hands free of the gloves, which are still in the Giant's grasp, revealing Loki's skin beneath. The wounded Jotun sees his chance, grabs hold of Loki's bare arm. Loki looks at his arm, prepared for the worst. But instead of the blackness of necrotizing flesh, Loki's arm turns BLUE -- like the Frost Giant's own skin. The blueness spreads painlessly up Loki's arm. He stares at it, confused. The Frost Giant is thrown as well, distracted by the unexpected phenomenon. Loki takes advantage of the distraction, KICKS the Giant.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Come on! But when he hurls his hammer to take out a Jotun, the Frost Giants seize the opportunity. A group of Jotuns swarm Thor from all sides, keeping him separate from his weapon. Mjolnir falls to the ground. A Frost Giant desperately struggles to lift Mjolnir off the ground, to no avail. Now free, the wounded Fandral looks relieved as Volstagg slings him over his shoulder, and the warriors start to leave. From his balcony, Laufey looks upon the battlefield, decides it's time to pull out the big guns. He touches a wall of the palace. An ENERGY WAVE sweeps from his touch, across the wall of the palace, and down to the ground below. The Asgardians hear a foreboding CRACK OF ICE below their feet.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: That can't be good.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Yes, it could! Might be an early spring! They look down, suddenly filled with dread when they see shadowy figures moving in the ice -- dozens of JOTUN WARRIORS awakening beneath the surface, rousing to join the battle. Loki turns to his brother, who battles a group of the Giants.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Thor, we must go! Thor, still without his hammer, fights his Jotun foes mercilessly, a man consumed by blood lust. Loki sees the look on his brother's face -- the savage thrill of the heat of battle.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Then go!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: There are too many of them!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I can stop them! The others hesitate. Jotuns break up through the ice all around them.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Thor! But Thor ignores his comrades, continues fighting.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Run! Reluctantly, the group flees back toward the inner edge of the planet as the Giants break up through the ice and give chase. Thor battles valiantly, but there's just too many of them. The Frost Giants swarm him from all sides now, as he disappears beneath a pile of blue flesh and ice. After a

Speaker: thor's fist
Dialogue: Forces its way up through the middle of the pile of Jotuns. He opens his hand, beckoning. One of Thor's attackers hears something ROARING up behind him. He whirls around -- BAM! -- Mjolnir nails him square in the face, then flies into Thor's outstretched hand. Thor raises the hammer up high, and brings it down on the ground with all his might. KRAKABOOM! Lightning strikes down from the sky, the hammer channeling the blast, firing the electricity out at the Jotuns around him. They're blasted back in a massive shockwave. The Jotuns convulse, drop dead to the ground.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Likely killed us all! As the Jotuns race towards the Asgardians, they open their mouths wide and breathe out an ICY FOG. The swirling mists quickly engulf the fleeing Asgardians before them. The Asgardians stand in the mist, unable to see. Hogun takes a step back, the ice cracking beneath him. They dare not move, for fear of falling through, into the void below. Thor sees he's put his friends in even greater danger. He raises Mjolnir high, SUMMONING THE WINDS. They lift him off the ground and carry him across the frozen wasteland to his comrades.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Loki, we have to see. Loki raises his arms, concentrates, the mists dissipating. But as they do, the Asgardians see before them the faces of the Frost Giants. And there are HUNDREDS of them -- too many, even for a Thunder God.

Speaker: odin allfather
Dialogue: Astride his powerful, eight-legged steed SLEIPNIR. He's clad in battle armor, Gungnir in his hand -- an imposing sight.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Laufey. End this.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Your boy sought this out.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You're right. These are the actions of a boy. Treat them as such. You and I can stop this before there's further bloodshed. Unseen by Odin and the others, Laufey starts to form an ice blade at the end of his arm.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: We are beyond diplomacy now, Allfather. He'll get what he came for -- war and death. Odin looks grim, determined.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: So be it. Without warning, Laufey swings his ice blade at Odin, but Odin is quicker. The Allfather brings his spear down upon the ice. Laufey and the nearest Jotuns go falling backwards in a wave, the ice cracking beneath their feet. The other Frost Giants turn tail and run. Thor watches the fleeing Jotuns with delight.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Now! We'll finish them together!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Silence! Odin raises his spear. The hole in the sky opens, the Bifrost energy blasting forth from it. The Bifrost envelops the Asgardians, yanks them off the ground and up through the hole. The vortex closes behind them as all falls silent. Laufey stares up after them contemptuously.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Why did you bring us back?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Do you realize what you've done? What you've started?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I was protecting my home.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You cannot protect your friends. How can you hope to protect a kingdom? Odin turns to the others.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: There won't be a kingdom to protect if you're afraid to act! Odin stares at him.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: That's pride and vanity that talks! Not leadership! Have you forgotten everything I've taught you? What of a warrior's patience, cunning?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: While you wait and be patient, the Nine Realms laugh at us! The old ways are done. You'd stand giving speeches while Asgard falls!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You're a vain, greedy, cruel boy!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: And you are an old man and a fool! The whole world seems to stop at Thor's words. Odin falls quiet. When he speaks again, there's something terrifying beneath the calmness of his words.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: A fool, yes! I was a fool to think you were ready. Loki takes a step towards Odin imploringly.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Thor Odinson... You have disobeyed the express command of your King. Through your arrogance and stupidity, you have opened these peaceful Realms and innocent lives to the horrors of war. The Allfather plunges Gungnir into Observatory's control panel. The turret turns, the Bifrost energy building along with Odin's rage. It FIRES, as the Bifrost opens at the end of the platform, creating a portal behind Thor. Odin turns angrily to his son.

Speaker: thor's pov
Dialogue: Thor opens his eyes to see Jane Foster staring at him, concerned. She looks vulnerable and beautiful.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Hammer...

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Yeah, we can tell you're hammered. That's pretty obvious. Jane notices something on the ground around them. She shines her flashlight down at the sand.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Erik... look at this. He joins her at her side and sees it. A faint, discernible pattern is etched into the sand. They exchange a look. Amazed and excited, Jane hurriedly takes out a camera and snaps some photos of the runes. A breeze begins to blow them away.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane, we need get him to a hospital. Jane kneels and quickly scoops up a soil sample in the cannister.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Not right now. It'll take too long. County's an hour away. We'll drop him off after we're done here. Selvig looks uncertain.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Father! Heimdall! I know you can hear me! Open the bridge!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Okay, you and Darcy take him to the hospital, I'll stay here.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: You expect me to leave you alone in the middle of the desert? Thor turns to the others, frustrated.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You! What world is this? The group is intimidated by his fervor.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: It's all right, my friend. We're going to get you some help. Selvig touches Thor's shoulder. Thor shoves him off, grows agitated, belligerent.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Where am I?! Answer me! Darcy reaches into her fanny pack, pulls something out of it. Jane looks on, concerned.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Erik, just back away...

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: You're in the desert outside the town of Puente Antiguo.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What Realm?! Alfheim? Nornheim?

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Uh... New Mexico? Darcy raises a TASER at him. Thor looks at the weapon, unsure what to make of it.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You dare threaten Thor with so puny

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: What? He was freaking me out.

Speaker: admissions nurse
Dialogue: Name?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: He said it was "Thor." The Nurse painstakingly types it into the computer, one key at a time. Jane watches as Thor is wheeled out of the room.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I've never met him before.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Until she hit him with the car.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Grazed him, actually.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I told you, I don't know him. I just want to make sure he's okay.

Speaker: admissions nurse
Dialogue: I'm going to need a name and contact number.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Jane Foster.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Oh, for God's sake... He reaches over Jane's shoulder and hands the Nurse his business card.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Hi. Just taking a little blood. Thor SLAPS the syringe away angrily, starts to sit up.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: How dare you attack the son of Odin!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I need some help! Two ORDERLIES race over, try to hold Thor down.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Then bring me a healing stone, you savages! He hurls one of them off, smashing against a wall. Now a couple SECURITY GUARDS and MALE NURSES join the fracas, all struggling to hold Thor down. Medical equipment goes flying, furniture overturned.

Speaker: orderly
Dialogue: What the hell is this guy on? Finally, they force him back down onto the gurney. Thor looks shocked and amazed that he's actually being overpowered by this small group. The NURSE injects him with a sedative.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're no match for the Mighty-- Thor struggles a beat, then passes out.

Speaker: townie
Dialogue: Huh.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Darcy, when you're done, take the soil samples to Professor Meyers in geology. Remind him, he owes me.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: We might want to perform a spectral analysis.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: "We?"

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I flew all the way out here -- might as well make myself useful. This is the offer Jane's been waiting for. She gets up, inserts the piece of equipment she's been working on into a rack-mounted server.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You know what would be really useful? Do you still have that friend at LIGO?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: She was more than a friend.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Could you call in a favor?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: You don't think this was just a magnetic storm?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: If I'm right, their observatory must have picked up gravitational waves during last night's event.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Meaning? Jane heads over to a computer monitor. Selvig follows.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Meaning these anomalies might signify something bigger.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: How "big" are we talking about? Jane indicates the footage on the monitor. As the last of the Bifrost cloud disappears into the night sky, there appears to be a blister in space, bulging out in convex and covered with stars.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I think the lensing around the edges is characteristic of an Einstein-Rosen Bridge.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I thought you were a science major.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Political Science. Selvig shoots Jane a confused look. Jane shrugs.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: She was the only applicant.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Stars.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Yes. But not our stars. She spreads out a STAR CHART, barely able to contain her excitement.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Hey, check it out. Jane and Selvig examine the photo, amazed.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Is that...?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I think I left something at the hospital. As Jane walks away, we REVEAL the photo. Inside the Bifrost funnel cloud is a FIGURE -- the vague, but unmistakable shape of a MAN.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: How could you have done this?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Do you understand what he set in motion? He's taken us to the brink of war!

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: But banishment? You would lose him forever? He's your son!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: What would you have done?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: I would not have exiled him to a world of mortals, stripped of his powers, to suffer alone. I would not have had the heart for such cruelty!

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: That is why I'm King.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: You can bring him back.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: No. His fate is in his own hands now.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It's not possible. He tries again, mustering all his strength. One of his hands slips free from its restraint.

Speaker: admissions nurse
Dialogue: I'm sorry, only relatives can visit patients.

Speaker: admissions nurse
Dialogue: I thought you said you didn't know him.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I meant I barely know him anymore. The man he's become. He's changed. I mean, what woman really knows her husband, anyway?

Speaker: admissions nurse
Dialogue: None of us, dear. He's in Room

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Typical. I just lost my most important piece of evidence.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: So now what?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: We find him.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Did you see what he did in there? I don't know if finding him is the best idea.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I want to know what that thing was, and he may have the answers. We don't have a choice.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Oo-kay. She pulls out her taser and a can of mace.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: So we're just going to spend the rest of the day looking for him?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: However long it takes. Jane puts the car in reverse and backs up, when --

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I'm so sorry. I swear I'm not doing that on purpose.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Blue sky... one sun... This is Earth, isn't it?

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I think you may have hit him with the car one time too many.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: We should never have let him go.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: There was no stopping him.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: At least he's only banished, not dead. Which is what we'd all be if that guard hadn't told Odin where we'd gone.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: How did the guard even know? Loki stares at his arm.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I told him.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I told him to go to Odin after we'd left. Though he should be flogged for taking so long.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: You told the guard?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I saved our lives! And Thor's. I had no idea Father would banish him for what he did.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Loki, you're the only one who can help Thor now. You must go to the Allfather and convince him to change his mind!

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: And if I do, then what? I love Thor more dearly than any of you, but you know what he is. He's arrogant. He's reckless. He's dangerous. You saw how he was today. Is that what Asgard needs from its King? The others exchange glances, torn. Loki has a point. He leaves the room. Hogun stares after him.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: He may speak about the good of Asgard, but he's always been jealous of Thor.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: True, but we should be grateful to him. He did save our lives.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: Laufey said there were traitors in the House of Odin. The others turn to the usually quiet Hogun.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Why is it every time you choose to speak, it has to be something dark and ominous?

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: A master of magic could easily bring three Jotuns into Asgard. The others look to Hogun, understanding the implication.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: No! Surely not!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Loki's always been one for mischief, but you're talking about something else entirely.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Who else could elude Heimdall's gaze with tricks of light and shadow?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: The ceremony was interrupted just before Thor was named King.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: We should go to the Allfather.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: And tell him what? "Oh, by the way, we think your son just betrayed the throne. And do us a favor. Bring back Thor. There's a good fellow!"

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: It's our duty. If any of our suspicions are right, then all of Asgard is in danger.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Am I cursed?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: No. Put the Casket down. Loki sets the Casket back upon its pedestal, his body quickly returning to its normal form and color. He stares at his father.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What am I?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You're my son.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What more than that? Odin doesn't answer. He looks suddenly weary, burdened. Loki sizes him up, realizes the truth.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Laufey's son... He desperately struggles to make sense of it all.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You were an innocent child.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You took me for a purpose, what was it? Odin doesn't answer.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: I thought we could unite our kingdoms one day, bring about an alliance, bring about a permanent peace... through you. But those plans no longer matter.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: So I am no more than another stolen relic, locked up here until you might have use of me.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Why do you twist my words?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You could have told me what I was from the beginning. Why didn't you?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You are my son. My blood. I wanted only to protect you from the truth.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Because I am the monster parents tell their children about at night?

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Don't...

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: It all makes sense now. Why you favored Thor all these years.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Listen...

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Because no matter how much you claim to "love" me, you could never have a Frost Giant sitting on the Throne of Asgard! Odin's body begins to shake, he lifts his hand. It starts to move out of synch temporarily, leaving a trail, the effect of the Odinsleep approaching. Loki doesn't notice as Odin tries to fight it off.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: Listen to me! Loki strides away towards the exit.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Guards!

Speaker: eager townie
Dialogue: This'll do it. He yells to the driver.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: You know, for a crazy homeless guy, he's pretty cut. Jane turns away. Thor emerges from the back room, holding a t-shirt.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Excuse me... excuse me! She leads him away from the work station. Thor holds up the t-shirt. On the front, it bear a sticker which reads: "HELLO, MY NAME IS DR. DONALD BLAKE". Thor looks at it, puzzled. Jane rips the sticker off.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: They will suffice. Thor turns his attention to the pictures of the Bifrost on the wall.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You're welcome. Now tell me... Thor studies the frame-grabs with interest. Jane points to his form in the Bifrost photo.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What does anyone do in the Bifrost? Everyone stares at him. Selvig seems to recognize the word. Jane opens her notebook, quickly writes the word down. Thor moves close to her, eyes the notations and drawings within the book, curious.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: The Bifrost... Jane starts to get uncomfortable with Thor standing so close to her, looking over her notations. She quickly closes the book.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What exactly is the Bifrost?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: I asked him to be honest with you from the beginning. There should be no secrets in a family.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: So why did he lie?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: He kept the truth from you so that you would never feel different. You are in every way our son, Loki, and we your family. You must know that. Loki takes this in, stares at Odin.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: How long will it last?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: I don't know. This time is different. We were unprepared.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I never get used to seeing him like this. The most powerful being in the Nine Realms lying helpless until his body is restored.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: But he's put it off for so long now, I fear... Loki takes her hand. She's grateful, wipes tears from her eyes.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What hope is there for Thor?

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: There's always a purpose to everything your father does. Thor may yet find a way home. Loki looks troubled by the revelation. He rises, heads for the exit, when they hear the clatter of ARMORED FOOTSTEPS hurriedly approaching.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Now tell us exactly what happened to you last night. Thor looks her in the eyes, staring, intrigued. Jane gets flustered, looks away.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: And how you could eat an entire box of Pop-Tarts and still be this hungry. Jane shoots her a withering look. Thor downs a cup of coffee.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: This drink. I like it.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Yeah, it's great, isn't it? Isabela makes the best coffee in town. Thor hurls the empty mug at the ground, SHATTERING it.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Sorry, Izzy. Little accident.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What was that? He doesn't understand. The other patrons stare at him.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It was delicious. I want another.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Then you should just say so!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I just did.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I mean ask for it. Nicely.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I meant no disrespect.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: All right, then no more smashing, deal?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You have my word.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: isabela
Dialogue: Morning, Pete. Jake.

Speaker: townie pete
Dialogue: The usual, please, Izzy. Isabela pours them a couple cups of coffee.

Speaker: isabela
Dialogue: What crater? Jane and Selvig overhear this, exchange a look, turn to the Townies with interest.

Speaker: townie pete
Dialogue: They're saying some kind of satellite crashed in the desert.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Excuse me, did you say there was a satellite crash?

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Oh my God, this is going on Facebook. Darcy whips out her cellphone.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: What did the satellite look like?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Where?!

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: I wouldn't bother! Looked like the whole Army was coming in when we left!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Twelve miles east of here. He starts to stride determinedly down the street. Jane walks with him.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: To get what belongs to me.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: So now you own a satellite?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It's not what they say it is.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Whatever it is, the government seems to think it's theirs. You intend to just walk in there and take it?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Yes. He stops walking.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Everything?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: All the answers you seek will be yours, once I reclaim Mjolnir. Darcy looks to the others.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: "Myeu-muh?" What's "Myeu-muh?" Jane studies Thor. He looks sincere. She's nearly swayed,

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane. He pulls her aside. Thor can tell that Selvig doesn't much care for him.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You know what we saw last night. This can't be a coincidence. I want to know what's in that crater.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I'm not talking about the crater. I'm talking about him.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: He's promised us answers.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: He's delusional! Listen to what he's saying! "Thor." "Bifrost." "Mjolnir." These are the stories I grew up with as a child!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I'd just be driving him out there, that's all.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: It's dangerous. He's dangerous.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I can't take you.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I understand. Then this is where we say goodbye. He takes her hand and kisses it.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: That's... thank you. Thor bows slightly to each of them.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Jane Foster... Erik Selvig... Darcy. Farewell. He heads off down the street. Selvig looks relieved.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Now... let's get back to the lab. We have work to do. Selvig and Darcy turn and start to go. Jane looks after Thor as he walks away down the street.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Allfather, we must speak with you

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Sitting sprawled upon his father's throne. He wears his horned ceremonial headdress and holds GUNGNIR in his hand. Sif and the others look up, shocked at the sight before them.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: My friends... you haven't heard? I am now Ruler of Asgard.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Where is Odin?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Father's fallen into the Odinsleep. My mother fears he may never awaken again.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: We would speak with her. Sif and the Warriors Three exchange a look. Loki notices.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: She has refused to leave my father's bedside. You can bring your "urgent" matter to me, your King. Sif covers quickly.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: We would ask you to end Thor's banishment.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: My first command can not be to undo the Allfather's last. We're on the brink of war with Jotunheim. Our people must have a sense of continuity in order to feel safe in these difficult times. Sif and the Warriors Three trade looks, not liking any of this.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Of course. Sif and the Warriors Three bow their heads and exit. Loki stares after them.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Hey! That's my stuff!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What the hell is going on here?! The Agents ignore her as Agent Coulson approaches.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Ms. Foster, I'm Agent Coulson, with

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I don't care who you work for, you can't do this!

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane. This is more serious than you realize. Let it go.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Let it go?! This is my life!

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: We're here investigating a security threat. We need to appropriate your equipment and all your atmospheric data.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: By "appropriate" you mean "steal?" Instead of answering, Coulson gives her a check.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: This should more than compensate you for your trouble. She throws the check to the ground without looking at it.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I can't just pick up replacements from RadioShack! I made most of that equipment myself!

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Then I'm sure you can do it again.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: And I'm sure I can sue you for violating my constitutional rights!

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: We're the good guys, Ms. Foster. He tries to walk away, but Jane blocks his path. She is fully herself, fueled by outrage.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: So are we! We're on the verge of

Speaker: understanding something
Dialogue: extraordinary. Jane holds up her notebook.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Thank you for your cooperation. He gets into a car. The cars and trucks pull away.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Years of research, gone.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: They even took my iPod.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: And your back-ups?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Look around! They took our back- ups. They took the back-ups of our back-ups.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I just downloaded, like, thirty songs on there.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: No one knows much about them. But I knew a scientist -- a pioneer in gamma radiation. SHIELD showed up, and he was never heard from again.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I'm not going to let them do this. I'm getting everything back.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Please, let me contact one of my colleagues. Dr. Pym has had some dealings with these people. I'll e- mail him and see if he can help.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: They took your laptop, too. Annoyed, Selvig thinks.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I'll just be a minute. He climbs out and heads inside. Jane looks down the street and sees something that intrigues her.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I need a horse.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Then give me one of those, large enough to ride. The Pet Store Clerk looks confused. Just then, Thor hears a CAR HORN. He turns to the open door. Across the street, Jane calls to him from the Pinzgauer.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You still want a lift?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I've never done anything like this before! Have you ever done anything like this before? Thor looks amused by her excitement.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Many times. You're brave to do it.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: They just stole my entire life's work. I really don't have anything left to lose.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: But you're clever. Far more clever than anyone else in this Realm.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: "This Realm?" Why do you talk like that?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You think me strange? Jane laughs, catches herself.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Yeah. Just a little.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Good strange or bad strange?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I'm not quite sure yet. She looks at him, sees him staring at her. She's lost in his gaze, distracted, when the PINZGAUER LURCHES. She quickly turns her eyes forward, regains control of the car.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You'll see soon enough.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You promised me answers.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What you seek -- it's a bridge.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: A bridge? Like an Einstein-Rosen Bridge?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: More like a rainbow bridge.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: God, I hope you're not crazy.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: That isn't a satellite crash. They would have hauled the wreckage away, not built a city around it. Thor shrugs out of his jacket and hands it to her.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're going to need this.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Why?-- Thunder RUMBLES overhead. She stares at him intently and takes his jacket.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Stay here. Once I have Mjolnir, I will return what they stole from you.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: No! Look what's down there! You can't just walk in, grab our stuff, and walk out!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: No. Jane looks relieved.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Wait... But Thor is already headed towards the crater.

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: Feed from the keyhole. Can barely penetrate the cloud cover. The Techie hikes a thumb at another monitor, SQUELCHING with static. It shows an SAR shot of the area, laid over a terrain map.

Speaker: sitwell
Dialogue: Reroute it, like all the others.

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: Right. Can I get the passengers some free drinks for the trouble? Sitwell glares at him.

Speaker: sitwell
Dialogue: DeLancey, Jackson -- check it out.

Speaker: agent delancey
Dialogue: Jackson? The Agents reach for their weapons. Thor elbows the driver across the jaw, causing him to drop his weapon.
