Thor reaches into the jeep to grab a rain slicker.

Speaker: shield agent
Dialogue: Agents down! We've got a perimeter breach!

Speaker: sitwell
Dialogue: Get Coulson. Sitwell punches an alarm.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Erik, okay, first of all, don't worry. I'm perfectly fine, really. More sounds of MAYHEM come from the base.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: I want eyes up high. With a gun. Now!

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Barton. Talk to me.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're big. Thor grins.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Barton...

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Ground units, move in. Show's over. As the Agents surround him, Thor doesn't seem to notice or care. He just sits there on his knees, head bowed in the rain -- a man broken, lost. From overhead, we see the hammer in the cube containment room. We pull up as the Guards approach Thor, then continue to climb, until we see the whole camp -- and the extensive damage Thor's done to it during the melee.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I can't just leave him there.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: You didn't see what happened. Darcy points at an illustration of Thor's hammer in the book.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Hey! Myeu-muh! Jane looks at the illustration in the book, turns to Selvig knowingly.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: In the children's section. I wanted to show you how ridiculous his story was. Jane is unconvinced by this. She knows he wants to believe.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Aren't you the one who's always told me to chase down all leads, all possibilities?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I was talking about science, not magic!

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Magic's just science we don't understand yet. Arthur C. Clarke.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Who wrote science fiction.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: The precursor of science fact.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: In some cases.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: If that's really an Einstein-Rosen Bridge out there, then there's something on the other side.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane...

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: A primitive culture like the Vikings might have worshipped them as deities. They give her a look, surprised by her unexpectedly insightful input. Darcy shrugs. Jane points at her, grateful for the support.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Yes! Exactly! Thank you! Darcy beams.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane, if you do this, you'll find yourself in a situation that I won't be able to get you out of this time.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: I'll help you. Jane looks grateful. Selvig looks at her, sees there's no stopping her. He sighs.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: It's not easy to do what you did. You made us all look like a bunch of mall cops. That's hurtful.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Just a man.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: One way or another, we find out what we want to know. We're good at that. Coulson leaves the room. Thor lowers his head.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Loki? What are you doing here?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I had to see you.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What's happened? Tell me! Is it Jotunheim? Let me explain to

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Father is dead. Thor stares at him, stunned.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Your banishment, the threat of a new war, it was too much for him to bear. The implications of Loki's words dawn on Thor -- he's responsible for his father's fate. Loki draws close to him, looks in his eyes, consolingly.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Can I come home?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: The truce with Jotunheim is conditional upon your exile.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: But couldn't we find a way to--

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Mother has forbidden your return. Thor nods, lowers his head, beaten.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: No, I'm sorry. Loki... thank you for coming here.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Nothing could have stopped me. Coulson enters the room, but seems to take no notice of Loki.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Good-bye.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Good-bye? I just got back. Thor looks up to see that Loki is gone.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: "Donald Blake?"

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Doctor Donald Blake. He's part of our team.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: You have dangerous coworkers, Dr. Selvig.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Troubled, not dangerous. He was distraught when he found out that you'd taken all of our research. It was years of his life, gone! He got depressed, started drinking, and... well, you know the rest.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Uh-huh. You mind if we take a moment to verify his identity?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Certainly. The Techie at a computer nearby runs the name.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: That doesn't explain how he managed to tear through our security. Selvig shrugs.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Steroids. He's a bit of a fitness nut.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: It says here he's an M.D.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: He is. That is, he was. He switched careers and became a physicist. He's quite brilliant, really.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Release Dr. Blake to Dr. Selvig here. The Techie looks to him, surprised.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Donny, Donny, Donny! There you are! Thor looks up, unsure what the hell is going on. Selvig pulls Thor to his feet, gives him a warm hug.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Just keep him away from the bars.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I will!

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: To get a drink. Selvig and Thor climb into the SUV. As they drive off, Coulson turns to the other two agents -- GARRETT and CALE.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Follow them.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Tell me why I shouldn't kill you.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I've come alone and unarmed.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: To what end?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: To make you another proposition.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You're welcome.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: My men are dead, and I have no Casket. You are a deceiver. Laufey lashes out, grabs Loki around the throat, but Loki calmly stands his ground.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You have no idea what I am. The blueness spreads across his face, as Laufey and the guards stare in shock. Loki grins.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Ah, the bastard son. I thought Odin had killed you. That's what I would have done. He's as weak as you are.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: No longer weak. I now rule Asgard, until Odin awakens. Perhaps you should not have so carelessly abandoned me. This gives Laufey pause.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Or perhaps it was the wisest choice I've ever made. I will hear you.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I will conceal you and a handful of your soldiers, lead you into his chambers, and let you slay him where he lies. I'll keep the throne, and you will have the Casket. Laufey studies Loki's face.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: Why would you do this?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: When all is done, we will have a permanent peace between our two worlds. Then I, the bastard son, will have accomplished what Odin and Thor never could.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: This is a great day for Jotunheim. Asgard is finally ours.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: No. Asgard is mine. The rest of the Nine Realms will be yours, if you do as you're told. Laufey considers the proposition.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: I accept. Loki turns to leave. As he goes, the slightest trace of a smile crosses his face.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What troubles you, Gatekeeper?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: I turned my gaze upon you in Jotunheim, but could neither see nor hear you. You were shrouded from me, like the Frost Giants who entered this Realm.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Perhaps your senses have weakened after your many years of service.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Or perhaps someone has found a way to hide that which he does not wish me to see. Loki sizes him up, smiles.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You have great power, Heimdall. Tell me, did Odin ever fear you?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: And why is that?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Because he is my King, and I am sworn to obey him.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Exactly. Just as you're sworn to obey me now. Yes? A beat.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Good. Then you will open the Bifrost to no one until I have undone what my brother has started. Loki heads out of the Observatory. Heimdall stares after him.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Seems Darcy's a terrible intern, but a talented hacker.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Thank you for what you've done.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Don't thank me. I only did it for Jane.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Are you in love with her?

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Of course not! Jane's like a daughter to me. Her father and I taught at University together. A good man, but he never listened. This registers with Thor.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Neither did I. Selvig eyes him with interest.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I don't know if you're really delusional, and I really don't care at this point. I just care about her. I've seen the way she looks at you.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I swear to you, I mean her no harm.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Good. If that's the case, then I'll buy you one more drink, and you'll leave town tonight. A long pause, then Thor nods. He takes a drink.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I had it all backwards. I had it all wrong. Selvig watches him keenly. This is a different Thor than he's seen before.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: It's not a bad thing, finding out that you don't have all the answers. That's when you start asking the right questions. Thor takes this in.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: For the first time in my life, I have no idea what I'm supposed to do.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Anyone who's ever going to find their way in this world has to start by admitting they don't know where the hell they are. Thor nods.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I have no quarrel with you. But she's a lady. You should be more respectful.

Speaker: drunk townie
Dialogue: And you should shut the hell up, princess. Selvig looks to Thor, concerned that he's going to lose it. But, to his surprise, Thor remains unaffected by the Townie's baiting.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Gentlemen, please. Let's keep our heads. Just then, Selvig HEAD-BUTTS the Townie, knocking him out. Thor's impressed. Selvig downs his drink, then hurls his glass aside, SHATTERING it on the ground.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Standing there with the unconscious Selvig slung over his shoulder.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Erik!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: He's fine. Not injured at all.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: We drank. We fought. He made his ancestors proud.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Put him on the bed. Thor moves through the small trailer carrying Selvig, like a bear lugging another bear, smashing into things along the way, until he finally sets Selvig down on Jane's bed. Selvig awakens groggily and looks up at him through bleary eyes.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I still don't believe you're the God of Thunder.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: These are your chambers? Jane suddenly becomes self-conscious. She starts cleaning up the mess around her.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Well, it's more of a temporary living space, really. I don't usually have visitors in here. Actually, never... Thor picks up a sock off the floor. She snatches it from him, puts it away.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I come up here sometimes when I can't sleep. Or when I'm trying to reconcile particle data. Or when Darcy's driving me crazy.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You've been very kind. I've been far less grateful than you deserve.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I also hit you with my car a couple times, so it kind of evens out. He grins, then reaches into his pocket and pulls out her

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: It was all I could get back. Not as much as I promised. I'm sorry.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: No, this is good. Thank you. This means I don't have to start from scratch... She sits down and opens the notebook eagerly, then stops, a harsh realization clouding her face. Thor notices.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: SHIELD, whatever they are. They're never going to let this research see the light of day.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You must do this. You must finish what you've started.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Because you're right. It's taken so many generations for your people to get to this point. You're nearly there. You just need someone to show you how close you really are.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: This is how my father explained it to me...

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Our dearest friend banished, Loki on the throne, Asgard on the brink of war, yet you manage to consume four wild boar, six pheasant, a side of beef, and two casks of ale. Shame on you! Don't you care?! Fandral moves to throw the platter in the fire, but Volstagg pulls his weapon, stopping him.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Do not mistake my appetite for apathy.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Stop it, both of you! We all know what we have to do, we're just too damned afraid to do it!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: It's treason, Hogun.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: To hell with treason, it's suicide.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Yes, yes, we know!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Thor would do the same for us. An EINHERJAR GUARD enters. They tense.

Speaker: einherjar guard
Dialogue: Heimdall demands your presence. Volstagg quickly drains his flagon of ale.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: We're doomed.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I need some coffee. The three head inside Smith Motors.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're very welcome. Jane joins them at the card table with a couple more plates. She and Thor sit with the others and start to eat their breakfast, looking like a little family.

Speaker: agent garrett
Dialogue: They want an update.

Speaker: agent cale
Dialogue: Tell them he's eating eggs.

Speaker: agent garrett
Dialogue: Scrambled or fried? Cale glares at him.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Thank you. Excuse me a moment. Thor leaves.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: To replace the one I broke. Please forgive my behavior.

Speaker: isabel
Dialogue: Okay. Thank you.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: If I may, I'd like to come back for more of your "coffee."

Speaker: isabel
Dialogue: Any time. He nods and walks away. She stares after him, smiling, and shrugs.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Good Heimdall, less us explain--

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: You would defy the commands of Loki our King, break every oath you have taken as warriors, and commit treason to bring Thor back? The four exchange nervous glances.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Yes, but--

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Good. The group looks puzzled. What did he just say?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: So you'll help us?

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: I am bound by honor to our King. I cannot open the Bifrost to you. With that, Heimdall leaves them alone in the Observatory. The others exchange puzzled looks.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Complicated fellow, isn't he?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Now what do we do? Sif glances at the control panel, notices something.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Look! The others turn to see HEIMDALL'S SWORD stuck into the control panel. They exchange a grin. They have an ally. Sif hits the controls, and the Bifrost apparatus fires up.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: What the hell was that?

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: I don't know, sir. We got massive energy readings out of nowhere, then they just disappeared. Fifteen miles due northwest.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Let's go take a look.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: He must have landed nearby. It's time to put our tracking skills to work. Spread out. Check the sand for indentations of his boot prints.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: The winds would have blown them away by now. We should look for signs of a campfire.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Or we could just start there. She points behind them to the town of Puente Antiguo in the distance -- the only visible sign of civilization -- and to Hogun, who has already started walking towards it. Volstagg and Fandral trade looks, their egos bruised.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: It's worth a look, I suppose. The party tromps towards the town.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: It has been a thousand years...

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Things change so fast here. You leave for a millennium, and it's like the whole neighborhood's gone. Volstagg sniffs, smells something.

Speaker: agent garrett
Dialogue: Is there a Renaissance Faire in town?

Speaker: agent cale
Dialogue: Call it in. But before they can, Volstagg rises up behind them, smashes their heads together. They're out.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Never cared for spies. He starts to go, then sees their bag of fast food on the ground. Intrigued, he pulls out a cheeseburger and takes a bite. He likes what he tastes.

Speaker: einherjar guard
Dialogue: My liege, the Warriors Three and the Lady Sif have gone missing. Loki reacts. He knows who's responsible.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Tell me, Loki, how did you get the Jotuns into Asgard?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: You think the Bifrost is the only way in and out of the Realm? There are secret paths between worlds to which even you with all your gifts are blind. But I have need of them no longer, now that I am King.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Then I need no longer obey you. Heimdall raises his massive sword, strides towards Loki. Loki reaches out and, with both hands, takes hold of something invisible, hovering in mid-air before him. As it quickly fades into view, we realize what it is --

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Ensure my brother does not return.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: My friends! Thor happily races over and greets his comrades. Jane, Selvig, and Darcy watch the Asgardians from across the room. Jane looks concerned. Selvig and Darcy eye them with wonder.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I don't believe it...

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Who are they?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Lady Sif and the Warriors Three. Surely you've heard tales of Hogun the Grim, Fandral the Dashing, and I, Volstagg the Svelte? Selvig looks pointedly at Volstagg's massive gut.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: My friends, I've never been happier to see anyone. But you should not have come.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: We're here to take you home. Jane reacts to the news of Thor leaving.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You know I can't. My father is dead because of me. I must remain in exile. The other Asgardians exchange puzzled looks.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Thor... your father still lives. Thor reacts to the revelation.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Get somebody from Linguistics out here. Just then, they hear a RUMBLING overhead, as the Bifrost storm ROARS in the sky above. Coulson and the SHIELD Agents scramble for cover, their vehicle windshields SHATTERING, as the Bifrost storm grows in strength. Finally, the hole in the sky overhead opens, and the funnel cloud EXPLODES out of it, touching down onto the desert floor. Coulson and the Agents shelter their eyes from the maelstrom.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Was somebody else coming? Just then, the Bifrost funnel EXPLODES down to the ground.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: I don't think so. But the guy doesn't tell me anything.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Leave this town now. Get yourself and your friends to safety.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I must stay and fight. The Asgardians look to Thor.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: You're but a mortal now. You'll get yourself killed!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Or one of us, trying to protect you.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: The best thing you can do is get the mortals to safety and leave the battle to us. Thor looks at the townsfolk around them, all oblivious to the oncoming threat.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Father. Welcome to Asgard.

Speaker: the destroyer
Dialogue: Strides down the street, a red, fiery energy glowing from within it. It unleashes BLASTS as it goes, blowing up cars, setting storefronts aflame.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Keep him distracted. She hurries off. The Warriors Three continue towards the behemoth.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: What do you think? "The Svartalfheim Twist?" "Kiss of the Hag?" "Face Full of Boot?" Volstagg grins eagerly.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: "The Flying Mountain." Hogun and Fandral groan.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Not "The Flying Mountain!" It threw out my back for a year last time!

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Trust me, it'll work.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: For Asgaaaaard!!!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: Leaps off a nearby rooftop with her two-headed spear and plunges it deep into the back of the creature. The creature stands there motionless, the fire dimming in its faceplate, Sif standing atop its back. The Asgardians have a brief moment of hope. But the creature stirs with life, its fire igniting once again. Sif looks on with growing trepidation. Slowly, unnaturally, the Destroyer spins its torso around 180 degrees to face its attackers. The Destroyer unleashes a blast at Sif. She barely dives off of the behemoth in time, dodging the blast. The Destroyer rises again to its full height, pulling free from Sif's staff, the weapon slipping through the slats of its armor. Sif and the Warriors Three try to regroup, when the Destroyer unleashes another blast, sending Sif and her comrades flying in all directions. Hogun's POUCH OF HEALING STONES breaks free, landing in the middle of the street.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Erik! She and Thor hurry to his side. He's losing blood, going into shock.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Come on... give me one! Amidst the useless powder, he finally finds one stone still intact. Thor tosses the pouch aside, holds the stone over the end of the iron rod.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: What are you doing? What is that? As the stone begins to glow, Thor crushes it. Jane looks on, amazed, as the glowing powder falls upon the piece of iron, dissolving it, heading downwards, until it reaches Selvig's wound. The powder heals his wound completely. Thor looks down the street, sees his wounded friends still lying there, as Selvig sits up in utter astonishment. He reaches through the hole in his shirt to touch his healed flesh.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: I'm really starting to like him. Jane turns to Thor to find he's gone.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Go, while you can!

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: But the others...

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You can't help them now. Your job is to survive. She struggles to sit up.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: No! I will die a warrior's death. Stories will be told of this day-- He gently takes her shield from her.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Live and tell those stories yourself. At last, she nods. Thor spots Volstagg lying unconscious, with Hogun and Fandral lying nearby. Thor makes his way towards them. Volstagg is barely breathing. Thor tries to pull him to safety, but it's no use. He won't budge. He rouses Hogun and Fandral.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: No. We can still fight!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: But not win. Move Volstagg, or he'll die! Thor looks at them, grins.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane, no! He pulls her into Smith Motors. A RAVEN flies overhead, watching the scene --

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Oh. My. God.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Donald... I don't think you've been completely honest with me.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: So, how can you speak our language?

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Your language? Ha! Silly girl, you're speaking ours. Thor calls up to the sky.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Heimdall! Open the Bifrost!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: He would open it if he could. I fear the worst.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Then we're trapped here forever.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Then I suppose we'd best start settling into our new lives. He looks to Darcy, turns on the charm.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: No. Thor shouts back up to the sky.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Heimdall!

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: Primitive. Good enough for hunting small game, I suppose. Suddenly, the Bifrost EXPLODES down from the sky. Thor grins. The mortals look on, amazed. Fandral turns to Darcy.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Sorry, my love. These things happen.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Know this, son of Coul. You and I, we fight for the same cause -- the protection of this world. From this day forward, count me as your ally.

Speaker: coulson
Dialogue: Not stolen. Borrowed. Jane shoots him a look. Coulson quickly continues.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Whatever fate lies before me, you are part of it. He takes her in his arms, kisses her passionately. Thor and the Asgardians leap into the Bifrost.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Get him to the healing room! Leave my brother to me.

Speaker: laufey
Dialogue: It's said you can still see and hear what transpires around you, even in this state. I hope it's true, so that you may know your death came by the hand of Laufey. He raises his blade above Odin's body, when --

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: And your death came by the son of Odin.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Standing behind him -- the sword stuck in his back. She looks to Loki, takes him in her arms.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Thor! She moves to Thor and hugs him, but Thor's eyes remain fixed on his brother. Loki looks at Mjolnir in his brother's hand.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Found its way back to you, did it?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: No thanks to you. Frigga picks up on the tension building between her sons.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Why don't you tell her? How you sent the Destroyer to kill our friends? To kill me? Frigga looks to Loki, alarmed and confused.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: It must have been enforcing Father's last command.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: You're a talented liar, brother. Always have been.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Jotunheim...

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: All these years, and no one's ever dared to use it as a weapon. Thor hurries to the ice, raises his hammer to SMASH through it to get to the controls frozen within. Before he can, Loki fires Gungnir. The blast hits the ice in front of Thor, blasting him back across the floor. Loki steps down from the ice as Thor staggers to his feet.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Why have you done this?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: To do what Father never could. To destroy their kind forever. When he awakens, he'll see the wisdom of what I've done.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: He won't! You can't kill an entire race!

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: What is this newfound love for the Frost Giants? You, who would have killed them all with your bare hands.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I've changed.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: So have I. Loki hits Thor across the face with Gungnir.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Is the throne really worth what you've done? What you would become?

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I never wanted the throne. I only wanted to be your equal. Now fight me!

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: I will not fight you, brother.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: I am not your brother. I never was.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Loki, this is madness... Loki grins.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Is it? He FIRES Gungnir at Thor. Thor dodges the blast, rolls to his feet.

Speaker: selvig
Dialogue: Jane?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Something's wrong.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: If you care so much for the Jotuns, then die with them. The Bifrost stretches every cell of Thor's body, trying to drag him away. He's nearly swallowed by the vortex, when he concentrates, mustering his will. He reaches out his hand towards the Bifrost. MJOLNIR flies back through the maelstrom, into Thor's hand. The hammer pulls him free. Loki tries to fire off another blast at him, but Thor takes to the air, speeds towards his brother.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Thor! Help me! Thor steps over to the side of the Bridge, sees Loki looking up at him desperately.

Speaker: lokis
Dialogue: I was always more clever than you.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Yet still not clever enough. With that, Thor raises his hammer, rising into the air, summoning lightning. A massive bolt strikes Mjolnir, then channels outwards, splitting up, striking each one of the Lokis. All of them dissipate into nothingness, save one -- the real Loki -- who's sent flying back across the Bridge, Gungnir knocked from his grasp. Thor steps over to his fallen brother, lying dazed on his back. Loki winces, prepares for the worst, when Thor steps away. Loki opens his eyes, tries to stand, but can't. He looks confused, then sees what the problem is -- Mjolnir rests atop his chest. Struggle as he may, Loki can't lift it off. He's pinned to the ground. Thor looks about him desperately -- at the Bifrost firing towards Jotunheim, gaining in strength, at the surge of energy moving through the Bridge. He's at a loss of what to do. Loki watches him smugly.

Speaker: loki
Dialogue: Look at you, the Mighty Thor. With all your strength, what good does it do you now? Thor knows Loki's right. He's powerless to stop what's happening. He looks down at the Bridge beneath his feet, VIBRATING from the force and speed of the Bifrost energy feeding into the Observatory. Then he gets an idea. He realizes what he must do -- and what he must sacrifice. Thor extends his hand towards Loki, summoning Mjolnir. The hammer goes flying to his grasp. Loki looks confused.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Forgive me. Summoning every bit of strength he has left, Thor raises Mjolnir one last time, drawing lightning to it from all sides, and brings it down with a final, terrible blow -- KRAKABOOM! The Bifrost SHATTERS, rainbow energy EXPLODING out of it. Both Loki and Thor are hurled into the air by the force of the blast. A wave of destruction moves forward along the Bridge towards the Observatory, breaking it apart as it goes. The Observatory RIPS ITSELF APART. As Loki and Thor fall together, Thor grabs hold of one end of Gungnir, while Loki still clutches the other. They both fall towards the MASSIVE WAVE of Bifrost energy which spews out from the broken Bridge. They're an instant from being blasted by the destructive force of the energy, carried away by the current, pulverized by the debris, when --

Speaker: odin allfather
Dialogue: Standing on the edge of the broken Bridge, awakened from the Odinsleep, restored to his full strength. Loki searches his father's face, looking for some kind of approval, some kind of redemption, but all he sees is disappointment and regret. Loki lets go.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: It is over.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: It's gone.

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: ...and then, with a mighty bellow, I flew at the great metal beast and laid it low...

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Is that another way of saying you fell on your huge a--

Speaker: volstagg
Dialogue: As a matter of fact, falling down was a tactic. Lulling the Destroyer into a false sense of security!

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Well, I was the one who had to drag your enormous carcass off the battlefield. That makes me the real hero. Doesn't it, Hogun? Hogun points to Volstagg.

Speaker: hogun
Dialogue: Big stomach.  Big mouth. The other gathered Asgardians laugh. Volstagg and Fandral look to Hogun. The grim warrior gives just a trace of a smile.

Speaker: fandral
Dialogue: Well, how about that? A smile! I'd say that calls for another drink! They laugh and raise another round. Frigga sits nearby, lost in thought, her face betraying the sadness she struggles to conceal. Sif notices, approaches Frigga, bows her head.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: My Queen. I am so sorry for your loss. Frigga takes Sif's hand appreciatively.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: Thank you, Sif. She looks to Thor, who's unable to enjoy the merriment around him.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: He mourns for his brother. And he misses her. The mortal. Frigga sees the trace of regret in Sif's face as she looks at Thor with new feelings. He rises and leaves the hall.

Speaker: frigga
Dialogue: He will need his friends now more than ever.

Speaker: sif
Dialogue: I will always be at his side. Frigga understands, puts her arm around Sif gratefully.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You'll be a wise King.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: There will never be a wiser king than you. Or a better father.

Speaker: odin
Dialogue: You've already made me proud. Odin leaves, Thor consoled by his words.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: Can you see her? Heimdall turns, gazes out towards Earth.

Speaker: heimdall
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: thor
Dialogue: How is she?

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: Here you go.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Thanks. Jane inserts the flash drive into the device.

Speaker: darcy
Dialogue: He would have come back if he could.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: I know. But if he can't get here on his own... Jane hits a switch on the device. Suddenly, a 3-D HOLOGRAPHIC PROJECTION bursts to life over the device, bathing the two women in its glow. We recognize what it is -- YGGDRASIL, in all its beauty.
